page.title: 06THE MINERS STRIKE 1984
page.content: Every Saturday morning my dad and I got up at 7 o'clock and caught the 2 minutes past 8 bus. We had to wait for about an hour. The people who gave out the food parcels also ran soup kitchens with the help of some others. The soup kitchens were only for the miners. There were a lot of people pleased to help the miners. At Christmas the people gave presents to the children. The miners children had parties at Moorends. We had a Christmas party and got 3 presents each. The 15-17 year olds got Â£5 each. We also had a trip to Scarborough in June. There were 12 buses and we got sweets,crisps and Â£5 each. We set off at 8a.m. and came back at 8.30p.m.. We are glad that the strike is over now. When the miners strike began we did not really suffer. We were getting a lot more than some people.
